I build and maintain reseller partnerships that enable distribution of GoDaddy's products and services in new markets. This includes managing and growing reseller partner revenues by training and influencing partner sellers and by refining value propositions to meet specific needs.

Now in its fifth year, the Technology Entrepreneurship & Management (TEM) program at Arizona State University’s Ira A. Fulton Schools of Engineering has quickly become one of the nation’s largest and fastest growing entrepreneurship degree programs. TEM offers the nation’s only undergraduate engineering college-based entrepreneurship degree.Located on ASU’s modern Polytechnic campus, this academic unit has 8 full-time faculty, 12 faculty associates and nearly 800 students. Entrepreneurship ‘TEM style’ means a technology savvy hands-on, real world approach to learning, ideating, innovating and creating. Our students and faculty focus on identifying important opportunities, tackling tough challenges, changing the world and making a positive difference.Input and involvement from our community stakeholders is important and valuable as TEM develops future strategies, initiatives and programs. An Advisory Board made up of these stakeholders is forming to allow TEM to tap the experience and wisdom of key entrepreneurs, social entrepreneurs, intrapreneurs, innovators, educators, consultants, and other business and community leaders.

summary: I am a passionate and ambitious individual that enjoys helping small businesses understand and achieve their goals with relation to their web presence.  I also do some domain buying/selling on the side and programming in .NET and C#.  If you are looking to integrate domain names into your already existing service or begin an entirely new domain name, web hosting, or SSL certificate reselling business, please contact me.
